title: The Jolly Bupbup
features: The Bupbup is small and jolly and has lived all her life in the wood field. But a dreadful thing happens in the wood field and the jolly Bupbup goes on an unexpected adventure. Lots of things always happen in the wood field.
description: "I really enjoyed this little book; it is perfect for young children. The text flowed with a nice rhythm. The font was child friendly; it was easy to read...The story is beautifully illustrated. The artwork nicely matches the story...Overall,
by Ann P.Borrmann is a lovely book that would be suitable for children ages three to five. Six to eight-year-olds may enjoy this story when they are learning to read. I rate this children's volume

."  --- ONLINE  BOOKCLUB                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                               "It is truly a book we will be reading over and over again.  I highly recommend it.
! --- JAZZY BOOK REVIEWS"It is an engaging story, with lots of charming descriptions...What makes

by Ann P. Borrmann stand out is a unique incorporation of fantasy characters and poetry. Borrmann starts with an excellent poem about theTwinkles. I would reread this just for that poem. It is a delightful rhyme advising how to meet the reclusive, tea-drinking creatures.... I like the choice not to show the Twinkles. I'm curious to know what they look like, but having an unknown fantasy creature pushes thereader's imagination.
"Combines masterful storytelling with fun and affection; deserves to be a children's classic." --
"A delightful storybook for young children, worthy of the most lively story hour."

--- INDIES TODAY It teaches lessons of perseverance and helping yourself overcomedisappointment while entertaining children and adults....I recommendthis story to parents, grandparents, caregivers, and anyone reading toyoung children.

--- GINA RAE MITCHELL REVIEWS "First of all, I found The Jolly Bupbup quite refreshing. It wasn't about what I expected. Furthermore, the language was playful and unfamiliar. I don't know what "bupbup" or "jelly middles" are but they are cute andkept me wanting to read along. I think the illustrations fit the storyperfectly. I could see this book being a favorite of one of my nieces or nephews. I would recommend it for toddlers to preschool-age children.The story is not too complicated but would be engaging for a little one. Even I was wondering what would happen next. The book includes a little poem at the beginning that would be nice for an early childhoodclassroom. The book is a stand-alone story but I think it could easilyturn into a series. Ann P. Borrmann does a good job at picking up onsome peculiar details while leaving other details unexplained to keepthe young reader wondering what will happen next."   ---REVIEWED BY JAMIE LEE WANDEL FOR READER'S FAVORITE

Ann Borrmann and her husband, Mark, currently live in a small town not too far from the wood field. She is the mother of four grown children and all her diligence has paid off as she now gets to be a grandmother. She enjoys indulging in her hobby, writing with a good cup of tea, and she hopes that this book will entertain the imagination of many little readers and story lovers.
